Class JerkVsFinishExperiment

java.lang.Object
  JerkVsFinishExperiment

public class JerkVsFinishExperiment
extends java.lang.Object

JerkVsFinishExperiment tests how often TotalJerkPlayers win against FinishFirstPlayers as the board has increasing numbers of PHolds and HoldQs.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Run a game of Chutes and Ladders and Pots. Create a die, a list of players, and a board, and prompt the user for instructions. An input of p should print a map of the board, i.e. location of every token, aid, obstacle and treasure pot and its status. An input of c should move the game forward one turn. An input of i should continue the game until it ends. An input of r should print status of each player/token; the position on the board and the number of treasure pieces in their possession. Any other input should end the game.

Parameters:
args - [0]: max value of the die. [1]: number of players. [2]: number of tokens per player. [3]: name of config file.

printMap

public static void printMap(Board board)
Print a map of the board.

board - the board used for the game.

takeTurn

public static boolean takeTurn( players,
                               Board board,
                               Die die,
                               int dRange,
                               int boardEnd,
                               int w,
                               double p)
Take a turn. Iterate through the list of players in turn order. Take the turn of each token each player chooses on its current space, and, if allowed, land them on their next space.

Parameters:
players - list of players in the game in turn order.
board - the board used for the game.
d - die that is used for the game.
dRange - upper number for the range of the die.
boardEnd - the index of the final space on the board.
w - the points for winning in this game.
p - the points for pieces in this game.
Returns:
if the game has ended.
